A heavy metal test checks for irregular levels of toxic or potentially harmful metals that have accumulated in the tissues of the body. We live in a toxic world and toxic metals can be found in the air, food, and water we consume. We do encourage urine testing. It involves the administration of a chelating (heavy metal-binding) agent intravenously. After the IV, you go home and collect your urine for the next 6 hours. We give you everything you need to send it off to the lab. Toxic Metals tested for at Natural Medicine and Detox includes... - Aluminum - Antimony - Arsenic - Barium - Beryllium - Bismuth - Cadmium - Cesium - Gadolinium - Lead - Mercury - Nickel - Palladium - Platinum - Tellurium - Thallium - Thorium - Tin - Tungsten - Uranium Exposure to heavy metals including arsenic, lead, cadmium, and copper is associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular disease and coronary heart disease. Calcification of the coronary arteries also plays a key role in the pathophysiology of atherosclerosis. Coronary artery calcification correlates highly with plaque burden, it is an excellent disease marker for atherosclerosis. Calcification is present in 55% of men and women under 40 years; all hearts show some calcification by age 50 in men, and by age 60 in women. A calcium score of zero is associated with a very low prevalence of any coronary atherosclerotic plaque. [Chelation](https://naturalmedicineanddetox.com/services-at-natural-medicine-detox/services-iv-therapies/services-chelation-iv-therapy/) can safely reduce calcification levels in your blood vessels. At Natural Medicine and Detox, we perform HRV Scan testing to evaluate your Heart Rate Variability, Pulse, and Physical and Emotional Health. Data Pulse Analysis & Heart rate variability (HRV) are measurable reflections of the balance between the two branches of the autonomic nervous system: the sympathetic and parasympathetic tone. Sympathetic is your "fight-or-flight" response. It manages increases in heart rate and blood pressure in emergency situations. Parasympathetic is what helps balance out the sympathetic nervous system and slows down the heart rate and lowers blood pressure, especially after a fight-or-flight situation. Heart rate variability (HRV) testing has also been extensively used as a marker for cardiac status and general health. Heart rate variability (HRV) is where the amount of time between your heartbeats fluctuates slightly. It takes special devices to register and analyze the heartbeat; but the results can indicate current or future health problems, including heart conditions and mental health issues like anxiety and depression.
